thread.title: The $30,000 Grammy’s goodie bag for this year is so swagged out it hurts
thread.title_full: The $30,000 Grammy’s goodie bag for this year is so swagged out it hurts

author: Gabriela Herstik
title: The $30,000 Grammy’s goodie bag for this year is so swagged out it hurts
text:
The $30,000 Grammy’s goodie bag for this year is so swagged out it hurts Although the term “goodie bag” is far more likely to conjure up images of childhood birthday parties than it is $30,000 gift baskets, for a select few at the 59th Annual Grammy Awards, the latter is the reality. Over 50 lucky presenters and performers at the February 12th award show will be going home with swag bags filled with everything from an adult bib and Chapstick to a lifetime supply of Oxygenetix moisturizer .
Oxygenetix Oxygenetix moisturizers , prices vary
This goodie bag is stuffed full of fun and unusual gifts, and thanks to Insider you can see every single thing included. But the grand slam, show stopping, most expensive and luxurious freebie in the goodie bag has to be a week-long stay at the Golden Door Spa in South California — valued at a whopping $8,850. As if it couldn’t get better, the spa donates all of its profits to help end child abuse.
Rain makes everything more beautiful ✨ 
A photo posted by Golden Door (@thegoldendoor) on Jan 24, 2017 at 4:58pm PST 
Other notable gifts in the goodie bag include a smart home system, plenty of books, a 90-minute cellulite-reducing massage, caramel and pretzel candies, hair extensions and more. Honestly, we don’t even know what we would do with all of the free stuff this Grammy’s goodie bag is providing.
BeBibs 
BeBibs adult bib , $18.94
Oomi Oomie home starter kit , $599
Chris Formant Bright Midnight, book by Chris Formant , $11.56
Gold Leaf Gourmet Gold Leaf Gourmet, dessert kit , $45
Slimware Plates, Slimware , $39.95
ChapStick ChapStick , $4.99
So whether you want to serve your new DIY gold-leaf desert kit on your new dinnerware, or simply enjoy some new nail polish, we’re sure you can find whatever you need in this gift bag…if you’re lucky enough to get one.
